thread.title: EastEnders fans blast show for ‘casual racism’
thread.title_full: EastEnders fans blast show for ‘casual racism’

title: EastEnders fans blast show for ‘casual racism’
text:
EastEnders fans blast show for ‘casual racism’ EastEnders fans blast show for ‘casual racism’ EASTENDERS was criticised tonight when Sylvie Carter performed a racist song. / Published 31st January 2017 
The Queen Vic was putting on a themed evening tonight but Sylvie Carter took it too far and performed an offensive song. 
The elderly lass dressed as a geisha and clad in a red kimono and she started reeling off an inappropriate rhyme and people on Twitter were angry. 
One person said: "Why would they allow Sylvie to go up there? Why is everyone in this show so stupid? #EastEnders." 
BBC RACIST: Sylvie performed an offensive rhyme 
"Not impressed – #Eastenders should be better than dressing an Alzheimer's sufferer as a 'stereotypical' Chinese lady – poor taste," said another. 
Others compared her performance to a Father Ted episode where he imitates the Chinese: "Did EastEnders just turn into Father Ted by offending London's Chinese community who just happened to have a night out in the Vic?" 
That wasn’t the only thing the programme was criticised for tonight as people were shocked oriental actors appeared in the pub for Chinese night. 
TWITTER TWITTER REACTION: Viewers took to Twitter to talk about tonight's episode 
TWITTER Alarmed: Viewers expressed their opinions online ““Did EastEnders just turn into Father Ted by offending London's Chinese community?” Twitter 
One viewer took to Twitter: "Was it not pure shocking of the writers to have Chinese people flock to a Chinese night though? 
"Like all round racist tonight." 
Luckily Sylvie’s performance was cut short when she was dragged off the stage but the punters were less than impressed and left in their masses. 
BBC OFFENSIVE: Sylvie dressed up for Chinese night Related videos
